ETYMOLOGY: Compound of view (from Old French vue 'sight' or 'appearance') + finder (from find). It refers to the device used to frame the image.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A device on a camera, typically an optical or electronic mechanism, that allows the photographer to see the exact scene that will be captured on film or sensor, aiding in composition and focusing.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 相机上的一种装置（通常是光学或电子机构），允许摄影师准确地观察将被胶片或传感器捕获的场景，有助于构图和对焦。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Modern mirrorless cameras often use a high-resolution electronic viewfinder instead of a traditional optical one.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 现代无反光镜相机通常使用高分辨率电子取景器，而不是传统的取景器。
